contextId.information: "As surely as Yahweh lives and as you live." Here Elisha compares the certainty that Yahweh and Elijah are alive to the certainty of what he is saying. This is a way of making a solemn promise. AT: "I solemnly promise you that" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: As Yahweh lives, and as you live

contextId.information: "As surely as Yahweh lives and as you live, I will not leave you." Here Elisha compares the certainty that Yahweh and Elijah are alive to the certainty of what he is saying. This is a way of making a solemn promise. See how you translated this phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:2ki:02:01|2:2]]. AT: "I solemnly promise you that I will not leave you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: As Yahweh lives, and as you live, I will not leave you

contextId.information: "As I know that Yahweh of hosts lives, before whom I stand, surely." Here Elisha compares the certainty that Yahweh is alive to the certainty that, if it were not for Jehoshaphat being there, he would not pay attention to Joram. This is a way of making a solemn promise. AT: "As surely as Yahweh of hosts lives, before whom I stand, I promise you, if it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: As Yahweh of hosts lives, before whom I stand, surely

contextId.information: This speaks how smooth Namaan's skin is after he is healed by comparing it to the skin of a young child. AT: "His flesh was restored again and was as soft as the flesh of a young child" or "His skin was well again and was smooth like a young child's skin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: His flesh was restored again like the flesh of a little child

contextId.information: "As surely as I know that Yahweh lives, before whom I stand." Here Elisha compares the certainty that Yahweh is alive to the certainty that he will not receive any gifts from Naaman. This is a way of making a solemn promise. AT: "As surely as Yahweh lives, before whom I stand, I promise you," (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: As Yahweh lives, before whom I stand

contextId.information: The Aramean army had so severely defeated the army of Israel that what remained was so worthless that it is compared to wheat chaff that the laborers walk on at harvest time. AT: "had crushed them as workers crush chaff under their feet at harvest time" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: made them like the chaff at threshing time
